sources.title: Tough Assignment
sources.description: "Tough Assignment" is a 1949 American action film directed by William Beaudine. The storyline revolves around a newspaper reporter and his attempts to expose a gang of beef smugglers. Don "Red" Barry stars as the newspaper reporter, while Marjorie Steele plays his wife. As the reporter gets closer to uncovering the truth about the smuggling operation, he and his wife face dangers and threats from the criminals involved. The film blends elements of action, drama, and suspense as the protagonists try to outsmart the antagonists and bring them to justice.

sources.title: Tough Assignment (1949) A film noir western: bullets, betrayal, and stolen herds of beef!
sources.description:
When a honeymoon collides with a meat-packing racket, this reporter couple must grill the truth out of a gang that plays for keeps. ðŸ¥©ðŸ”¥
Newlyweds Dan and Margie Reilly stumble onto a black-market beef operation while on their honeymoon. With Boss Morgan's thugs silencing witnesses and sabotaging evidence, the duo races to expose the conspiracy before they become the next targets.

Original Title: Tough Assignment (1949)
Alternative title: Cowboy-Gangster

metadata.Plot: Don Reilly, a Los Angeles newspaper reporter in 1949, recently married to Margie, a photographer employed by the same newspaper, stumbles upon the fact that gangsters are forcing butcher shops to sell their unlicensed beef, and he persuades his managing editor to allow him to follow up on the story. His bride goes with him on an investigation that leads him to the ranch hideout of the gang, who are rustling cattle using fast, refrigeration trucks.
metadata.Actors: Don 'Red' Barry, Marjorie Steele, Steve Brodie
